ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Developed critical analysis and reading skills, as well as developed my ability to put abstract ideas into words.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The syllabus design was really great, and the class touched on very interesting topics that led us to understand how money has come to play such a central role in our lives today!

I liked everything about this class. It was engaging and well-organized. I think the only way it could be improved is a better forum for discussion in regards to our written responses to the weekly readings.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would absolutely recommend this course. The subject material is absolutely fascinating and feels so relevant, every week, to real life. Take it if you want a more nuanced understanding of the role money plays in so many different aspects of our lives. Professor Thomae is also a wonderful professor - if he comes back to Yale and you have the chance to take a course with him, you absolutely should.
